ul.li: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

div.p: This position contributes to the development and qualification of advanced lithium ion battery technology for portable power consumer applications. The candidate will work with internal cross-functional teams to develop electrochemical models to support design of advanced algorithms for battery management systems (BMS), fast charging algorithms, simulate cell performance under a wide range of loads, operating conditions and aging mechanisms, and to validate the models to high levels of confidence.

ul.li: Four years or more of physics-based modeling of electrochemical or general transport-reaction processes and performance / safety characterization experience with emphasis on lithium ion or lithium polymer batteries
Familiarity with applicable test equipment, test procedures, international standards and certified agency requirements applicable to rechargeable lithium battery products
Familiarity with current state of the art production processes applicable to lithium rechargeable cells

Experience applying quality tools and their application to development, characterization and production of lithium batteries, including statistical analysis of performance results, process capabilities, and design of experiments
Familiarity with applicable patent field and patent application process
Strong aptitude in mathematical modeling of linear and nonlinear dynamical systems and distributed parameter systems.
Solid competency in numerical solutions of PDEs and ODEs
Ability to motivate and work independently with minimal oversight required
Ability to interact effectively with other engineers and teams
Strong process oriented and data driven work culture
Self-starter with excellent time management skills and entrepreneurial spirit
Ability to clearly understand and explain technical issues
Ability to clearly justify technical decisions based on data and results

div.p: • Mathematical modeling of the electrochemical behavior of lithium ion cells using partial differential equations (PDEs) or systems of ordinary differential equations (ODEs) • Translate aging mechanisms into mathematical representations that can be accommodated by existing models • Work with battery pack engineers to generate reduced-order models that can be used as a basis for advanced BMS designs • Work with cell and battery engineering groups to verify accuracy of mathematical models and performance simulation of new cell designs • Conduct investigations, prepare status reports related to design and performance issues, and contribute to resolving issues as required • Pursue development of intellectual property to protect technology developments and secure competitive position • Act as technical contact point for electrochemical characterization and mathematical modeling software, techniques and application
PhD in Chemical, Mechanical, or Control Engineering
Travel to external vendors, suppliers and manufacturing facilities is expected
